content.question: Which of the following could be used to find the slope of the line tangent to the curve <math alttext="the inverse tangent of, open parenthesis, x minus 2 y, plus 2, close parenthesis, equals, x squared, minus 3 y, plus the inverse tangent of, open parenthesis, 2, close parenthesis, minus 1" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mrow><msup><mrow><mi>tan</mi></mrow><mrow><mo>−</mo><mn>1</mn></mrow></msup><mo stretchy="false">(</mo><mi>x</mi><mo>−</mo><mn>2</mn><mi>y</mi><mo>+</mo><mn>2</mn><mo stretchy="false">)</mo><mo>=</mo><msup><mrow><mi>x</mi></mrow><mrow><mn>2</mn></mrow></msup><mo>−</mo><mn>3</mn><mi>y</mi><mo>+</mo><msup><mrow><mi>tan</mi></mrow><mrow><mo>−</mo><mn>1</mn></mrow></msup><mo stretchy="false">(</mo><mn>2</mn><mo stretchy="false">)</mo><mo>−</mo><mn>1</mn></mrow></mrow></mstyle></math> ?

choices.label: <math alttext="the fraction with numerator 1, and denominator 1 plus, open parenthesis, x minus 2 y, plus 2, close parenthesis, squared, end fraction, equals, 2 x, minus 3 times the derivative of y, with respect to x" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mfrac><mrow><mn>1</mn></mrow><mrow><mn>1</mn><mo>+</mo><msup><mrow><mo stretchy="false">(</mo><mi>x</mi><mo>−</mo><mn>2</mn><mi>y</mi><mo>+</mo><mn>2</mn><mo stretchy="false">)</mo></mrow><mrow><mn>2</mn></mrow></msup></mrow></mfrac><mo>=</mo><mn>2</mn><mi>x</mi><mo>−</mo><mn>3</mn><mfrac><mrow><mi>d</mi><mi>y</mi></mrow><mrow><mi>d</mi><mi>x</mi></mrow></mfrac></mrow></mstyle></math>

<math alttext="the fraction with numerator negative 1, and denominator 1 plus, open parenthesis, x minus 2 y, plus 2, close parenthesis, squared, end fraction, equals, 2 x minus 3" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mfrac><mrow><mrow><mo>−</mo><mn>1</mn></mrow></mrow><mrow><mn>1</mn><mo>+</mo><msup><mrow><mo stretchy="false">(</mo><mi>x</mi><mo>−</mo><mn>2</mn><mi>y</mi><mo>+</mo><mn>2</mn><mo stretchy="false">)</mo></mrow><mrow><mn>2</mn></mrow></msup></mrow></mfrac><mo>=</mo><mn>2</mn><mi>x</mi><mo>−</mo><mn>3</mn></mrow></mstyle></math>

<math alttext="the fraction with numerator 1, minus 2 times the derivative of y, with respect to x, and denominator 1 plus, open parenthesis, x minus 2 y, plus 2, close parenthesis, squared, end fraction, equals, 2 x, minus 3 times the derivative of y, with respect to x" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mfrac><mrow><mn>1</mn><mo>−</mo><mn>2</mn><mfrac><mrow><mi>d</mi><mi>y</mi></mrow><mrow><mi>d</mi><mi>x</mi></mrow></mfrac></mrow><mrow><mn>1</mn><mo>+</mo><msup><mrow><mo stretchy="false">(</mo><mi>x</mi><mo>−</mo><mn>2</mn><mi>y</mi><mo>+</mo><mn>2</mn><mo stretchy="false">)</mo></mrow><mrow><mn>2</mn></mrow></msup></mrow></mfrac><mo>=</mo><mn>2</mn><mi>x</mi><mo>−</mo><mn>3</mn><mfrac><mrow><mi>d</mi><mi>y</mi></mrow><mrow><mi>d</mi><mi>x</mi></mrow></mfrac></mrow></mstyle></math>

<math alttext="the fraction with numerator 1, minus 2 times the derivative of y, with respect to x, and denominator 1 plus, open parenthesis, x minus 2 y, plus 2, close parenthesis, end fraction, equals, 2 x, minus 3 times the derivative of y, with respect to x" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mfrac><mrow><mn>1</mn><mo>−</mo><mn>2</mn><mfrac><mrow><mi>d</mi><mi>y</mi></mrow><mrow><mi>d</mi><mi>x</mi></mrow></mfrac></mrow><mrow><mn>1</mn><mo>+</mo><mo stretchy="false">(</mo><mi>x</mi><mo>−</mo><mn>2</mn><mi>y</mi><mo>+</mo><mn>2</mn><mo stretchy="false">)</mo></mrow></mfrac><mo>=</mo><mn>2</mn><mi>x</mi><mo>−</mo><mn>3</mn><mfrac><mrow><mi>d</mi><mi>y</mi></mrow><mrow><mi>d</mi><mi>x</mi></mrow></mfrac></mrow></mstyle></math>

content.answer: <math alttext="the fraction with numerator 1, minus 2 times the derivative of y, with respect to x, and denominator 1 plus, open parenthesis, x minus 2 y, plus 2, close parenthesis, squared, end fraction, equals, 2 x, minus 3 times the derivative of y, with respect to x" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mfrac><mrow><mn>1</mn><mo>−</mo><mn>2</mn><mfrac><mrow><mi>d</mi><mi>y</mi></mrow><mrow><mi>d</mi><mi>x</mi></mrow></mfrac></mrow><mrow><mn>1</mn><mo>+</mo><msup><mrow><mo stretchy="false">(</mo><mi>x</mi><mo>−</mo><mn>2</mn><mi>y</mi><mo>+</mo><mn>2</mn><mo stretchy="false">)</mo></mrow><mrow><mn>2</mn></mrow></msup></mrow></mfrac><mo>=</mo><mn>2</mn><mi>x</mi><mo>−</mo><mn>3</mn><mfrac><mrow><mi>d</mi><mi>y</mi></mrow><mrow><mi>d</mi><mi>x</mi></mrow></mfrac></mrow></mstyle></math>

unit.text: 3: Differentiation: Composite, Implicit, and Inverse Functions

skill.text: Skill 1.C: Identify an appropriate mathematical rule or procedure based on the classification of a given expression (e.g., Use the chain rule to find the derivative of a composite function).
